etymology.description: phonetic: 我(我) (wǒ, 'I') + semantic: 羊(羊) (yáng, 'good; beautiful; auspicious') -> righteousness
etymology.interpretation: The character 義(yì, 'righteousness') combines 我(我) (wǒ, 'I'), which provides the pronunciation, with 羊(羊) (yáng, 'good; beautiful; auspicious'), suggesting moral goodness or virtue. This combination implies a personal embodiment of these positive qualities, aligning with the meaning of righteousness.
etymology.simplification: The simplified form 义 retains the basic structure but reduces the complexity by removing 我(我) (wǒ, 'I'), leaving a stylized version of 羊(羊) (yáng, 'good; beautiful; auspicious').

examples.chinese: 他以義待人(他以義待人)，不辜負朋友(不辜負朋友)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ yì dài rén, bù gūfù péngyǒu.
examples.english: He treats people with righteousness and never disappoints his friends.

examples.chinese: 為了伸張義(為了伸張義)，他勇敢奮戰(他勇敢奮戰)。
examples.pinyin: Wèi le shēnzhāng yì, tā yǒnggǎn fènzhàn.
examples.english: To promote righteousness, he fought valiantly.
His loyalty and righteousness are unparalleled.
